findings.title: Hardcoded addresses are not advisable
findings.description: Hardcoded addresses in the contract (MarketResearch, DesigningAndDevelopment, InvestorsUsersAcquisition, UpgradeAndMaintenance, AdministrativeLegalExpenses, and Others) pose a greater risk of compromise as there is no setter function to update them later if needed.

findings.title: State mutability of decimals can be made pure
findings.description: The decimals variable's state mutability can be changed to pure, which may improve code efficiency and security.

findings.title: No access control implemented
findings.description: There is no access control implemented in the contract and as such, key functions (approve, transfer, transferFrom) are vulnerable to malicious actors.
